068@Category({ MiscTests.class, MediumTests.class })

088  @Test
089  public void testIsHDFS() throws Exception {
090    assertFalse(CommonFSUtils.isHDFS(conf));
091    MiniDFSCluster cluster = null;
092    try {
093      cluster = htu.startMiniDFSCluster(1);
094      assertTrue(CommonFSUtils.isHDFS(conf));
095    } finally {
096      if (cluster != null) {
097        cluster.shutdown();
098      }
099    }
100  }
101
102  private void WriteDataToHDFS(FileSystem fs, Path file, int dataSize) throws Exception {
103    FSDataOutputStream out = fs.create(file);
104    byte[] data = new byte[dataSize];
105    out.write(data, 0, dataSize);
106    out.close();
107  }
108
109  @Test
110  public void testComputeHDFSBlocksDistributionByInputStream() throws Exception {
111    testComputeHDFSBlocksDistribution((fs, testFile) -> {
112      try (FSDataInputStream open = fs.open(testFile)) {
113        assertTrue(open instanceof HdfsDataInputStream);
114        return FSUtils.computeHDFSBlocksDistribution((HdfsDataInputStream) open);
115      }
116    });
117  }
118
119  @Test
120  public void testComputeHDFSBlockDistribution() throws Exception {
121    testComputeHDFSBlocksDistribution((fs, testFile) -> {
122      FileStatus status = fs.getFileStatus(testFile);
123      return FSUtils.computeHDFSBlocksDistribution(fs, status, 0, status.getLen());
124    });
125  }
126
127  @FunctionalInterface
128  interface HDFSBlockDistributionFunction {
129    HDFSBlocksDistribution getForPath(FileSystem fs, Path path) throws IOException;
130  }
131
132  private void testComputeHDFSBlocksDistribution(
133    HDFSBlockDistributionFunction fileToBlockDistribution) throws Exception {
134    final int DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE = 1024;
135    conf.setLong("dfs.blocksize", DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE);
136    MiniDFSCluster cluster = null;
137    Path testFile = null;
138
139    try {
140      // set up a cluster with 3 nodes
141      String hosts[] = new String[] { "host1", "host2", "host3" };
142      cluster = htu.startMiniDFSCluster(hosts);
143      cluster.waitActive();
144      FileSystem fs = cluster.getFileSystem();
145
146      // create a file with two blocks
147      testFile = new Path("/test1.txt");
148      WriteDataToHDFS(fs, testFile, 2 * DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE);
149
150      // given the default replication factor is 3, the same as the number of
151      // datanodes; the locality index for each host should be 100%,
152      // or getWeight for each host should be the same as getUniqueBlocksWeights
153      final long maxTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime() + 2000;
154      boolean ok;
155      do {
156        ok = true;
157
158        HDFSBlocksDistribution blocksDistribution =
159          fileToBlockDistribution.getForPath(fs, testFile);
160
161        long uniqueBlocksTotalWeight = blocksDistribution.getUniqueBlocksTotalWeight();
162        for (String host : hosts) {
163          long weight = blocksDistribution.getWeight(host);
164          ok = (ok && uniqueBlocksTotalWeight == weight);
165        }
166      } while (!ok && EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime() < maxTime);
167      assertTrue(ok);
168    } finally {
169      htu.shutdownMiniDFSCluster();
170    }
171
172    try {
173      // set up a cluster with 4 nodes
174      String hosts[] = new String[] { "host1", "host2", "host3", "host4" };
175      cluster = htu.startMiniDFSCluster(hosts);
176      cluster.waitActive();
177      FileSystem fs = cluster.getFileSystem();
178
179      // create a file with three blocks
180      testFile = new Path("/test2.txt");
181      WriteDataToHDFS(fs, testFile, 3 * DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE);
182
183      // given the default replication factor is 3, we will have total of 9
184      // replica of blocks; thus the host with the highest weight should have
185      // weight == 3 * DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE
186      final long maxTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime() + 2000;
187      long weight;
188      long uniqueBlocksTotalWeight;
189      do {
190        HDFSBlocksDistribution blocksDistribution =
191          fileToBlockDistribution.getForPath(fs, testFile);
192        uniqueBlocksTotalWeight = blocksDistribution.getUniqueBlocksTotalWeight();
193
194        String tophost = blocksDistribution.getTopHosts().get(0);
195        weight = blocksDistribution.getWeight(tophost);
196
197        // NameNode is informed asynchronously, so we may have a delay. See HBASE-6175
198      } while (uniqueBlocksTotalWeight != weight && EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime() < maxTime);
199      assertTrue(uniqueBlocksTotalWeight == weight);
200
201    } finally {
202      htu.shutdownMiniDFSCluster();
203    }
204
205    try {
206      // set up a cluster with 4 nodes
207      String hosts[] = new String[] { "host1", "host2", "host3", "host4" };
208      cluster = htu.startMiniDFSCluster(hosts);
209      cluster.waitActive();
210      FileSystem fs = cluster.getFileSystem();
211
212      // create a file with one block
213      testFile = new Path("/test3.txt");
214      WriteDataToHDFS(fs, testFile, DEFAULT_BLOCK_SIZE);
215
216      // given the default replication factor is 3, we will have total of 3
217      // replica of blocks; thus there is one host without weight
218      final long maxTime = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime() + 2000;
219      HDFSBlocksDistribution blocksDistribution;
220      do {
221        blocksDistribution = fileToBlockDistribution.getForPath(fs, testFile);
222        // NameNode is informed asynchronously, so we may have a delay. See HBASE-6175
223      } while (
224        blocksDistribution.getTopHosts().size() != 3
225          && EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime() < maxTime
226      );
227      assertEquals("Wrong number of hosts distributing blocks.", 3,
228        blocksDistribution.getTopHosts().size());
229    } finally {
230      htu.shutdownMiniDFSCluster();
231    }
232  }
233
234  private void writeVersionFile(Path versionFile, String version) throws IOException {
235    if (CommonFSUtils.isExists(fs, versionFile)) {
236      assertTrue(CommonFSUtils.delete(fs, versionFile, true));
237    }
238    try (FSDataOutputStream s = fs.create(versionFile)) {
239      s.writeUTF(version);
240    }
241    assertTrue(fs.exists(versionFile));
242  }
243
244  @Test
245  public void testVersion() throws DeserializationException, IOException {
246    final Path rootdir = htu.getDataTestDir();
247    final FileSystem fs = rootdir.getFileSystem(conf);
248    assertNull(FSUtils.getVersion(fs, rootdir));
249    // No meta dir so no complaint from checkVersion.
250    // Presumes it a new install. Will create version file.
251    FSUtils.checkVersion(fs, rootdir, true);
252    // Now remove the version file and create a metadir so checkVersion fails.
253    Path versionFile = new Path(rootdir, HConstants.VERSION_FILE_NAME);
254    assertTrue(CommonFSUtils.isExists(fs, versionFile));
255    assertTrue(CommonFSUtils.delete(fs, versionFile, true));
256    Path metaRegionDir =
257      FSUtils.getRegionDirFromRootDir(rootdir, RegionInfoBuilder.FIRST_META_REGIONINFO);
258    FsPermission defaultPerms =
259      CommonFSUtils.getFilePermissions(fs, this.conf, HConstants.DATA_FILE_UMASK_KEY);
260    CommonFSUtils.create(fs, metaRegionDir, defaultPerms, false);
261    boolean thrown = false;
262    try {
263      FSUtils.checkVersion(fs, rootdir, true);
264    } catch (FileSystemVersionException e) {
265      thrown = true;
266    }
267    assertTrue("Expected FileSystemVersionException", thrown);
268    // Write out a good version file. See if we can read it in and convert.
269    String version = HConstants.FILE_SYSTEM_VERSION;
270    writeVersionFile(versionFile, version);
271    FileStatus[] status = fs.listStatus(versionFile);
272    assertNotNull(status);
273    assertTrue(status.length > 0);
274    String newVersion = FSUtils.getVersion(fs, rootdir);
275    assertEquals(version.length(), newVersion.length());
276    assertEquals(version, newVersion);
277    // File will have been converted. Exercise the pb format
278    assertEquals(version, FSUtils.getVersion(fs, rootdir));
279    FSUtils.checkVersion(fs, rootdir, true);
280    // Write an old version file.
281    String oldVersion = "1";
282    writeVersionFile(versionFile, oldVersion);
283    newVersion = FSUtils.getVersion(fs, rootdir);
284    assertNotEquals(version, newVersion);
285    thrown = false;
286    try {
287      FSUtils.checkVersion(fs, rootdir, true);
288    } catch (FileSystemVersionException e) {
289      thrown = true;
290    }
291    assertTrue("Expected FileSystemVersionException", thrown);
292  }
293
294  @Test
295  public void testPermMask() throws Exception {
296    final Path rootdir = htu.getDataTestDir();
297    final FileSystem fs = rootdir.getFileSystem(conf);
298    // default fs permission
299    FsPermission defaultFsPerm =
300      CommonFSUtils.getFilePermissions(fs, conf, HConstants.DATA_FILE_UMASK_KEY);
301    // 'hbase.data.umask.enable' is false. We will get default fs permission.
302    assertEquals(FsPermission.getFileDefault(), defaultFsPerm);
303
304    conf.setBoolean(HConstants.ENABLE_DATA_FILE_UMASK, true);
305    // first check that we don't crash if we don't have perms set
306    FsPermission defaultStartPerm =
307      CommonFSUtils.getFilePermissions(fs, conf, HConstants.DATA_FILE_UMASK_KEY);
308    // default 'hbase.data.umask'is 000, and this umask will be used when
309    // 'hbase.data.umask.enable' is true.
310    // Therefore we will not get the real fs default in this case.
311    // Instead we will get the starting point FULL_RWX_PERMISSIONS
312    assertEquals(new FsPermission(CommonFSUtils.FULL_RWX_PERMISSIONS), defaultStartPerm);
313
314    conf.setStrings(HConstants.DATA_FILE_UMASK_KEY, "077");
315    // now check that we get the right perms
316    FsPermission filePerm =
317      CommonFSUtils.getFilePermissions(fs, conf, HConstants.DATA_FILE_UMASK_KEY);
318    assertEquals(new FsPermission("700"), filePerm);
319
320    // then that the correct file is created
321    Path p = new Path("target" + File.separator + HBaseTestingUtil.getRandomUUID().toString());
322    try {
323      FSDataOutputStream out = FSUtils.create(conf, fs, p, filePerm, null);
324      out.close();
325      FileStatus stat = fs.getFileStatus(p);
326      assertEquals(new FsPermission("700"), stat.getPermission());
327      // and then cleanup
328    } finally {
329      fs.delete(p, true);
330    }
331  }
332
333  @Test
334  public void testDeleteAndExists() throws Exception {
335    final Path rootdir = htu.getDataTestDir();
336    final FileSystem fs = rootdir.getFileSystem(conf);
337    conf.setBoolean(HConstants.ENABLE_DATA_FILE_UMASK, true);
338    FsPermission perms = CommonFSUtils.getFilePermissions(fs, conf, HConstants.DATA_FILE_UMASK_KEY);
339    // then that the correct file is created
340    String file = HBaseTestingUtil.getRandomUUID().toString();
341    Path p = new Path(htu.getDataTestDir(), "temptarget" + File.separator + file);
342    Path p1 = new Path(htu.getDataTestDir(), "temppath" + File.separator + file);
343    try {
344      FSDataOutputStream out = FSUtils.create(conf, fs, p, perms, null);
345      out.close();
346      assertTrue("The created file should be present", CommonFSUtils.isExists(fs, p));
347      // delete the file with recursion as false. Only the file will be deleted.
348      CommonFSUtils.delete(fs, p, false);
349      // Create another file
350      FSDataOutputStream out1 = FSUtils.create(conf, fs, p1, perms, null);
351      out1.close();
352      // delete the file with recursion as false. Still the file only will be deleted
353      CommonFSUtils.delete(fs, p1, true);
354      assertFalse("The created file should be present", CommonFSUtils.isExists(fs, p1));
355      // and then cleanup
356    } finally {
357      CommonFSUtils.delete(fs, p, true);
358      CommonFSUtils.delete(fs, p1, true);
359    }
360  }
361
362  @Test
363  public void testFilteredStatusDoesNotThrowOnNotFound() throws Exception {
364    MiniDFSCluster cluster = htu.startMiniDFSCluster(1);
365    try {
366      assertNull(FSUtils.listStatusWithStatusFilter(cluster.getFileSystem(),
367        new Path("definitely/doesn't/exist"), null));
368    } finally {
369      cluster.shutdown();
370    }
371
372  }

374  @Test
375  public void testRenameAndSetModifyTime() throws Exception {
376    MiniDFSCluster cluster = htu.startMiniDFSCluster(1);
377    assertTrue(CommonFSUtils.isHDFS(conf));
378
379    FileSystem fs = FileSystem.get(conf);
380    Path testDir = htu.getDataTestDirOnTestFS("testArchiveFile");
381
382    String file = HBaseTestingUtil.getRandomUUID().toString();
383    Path p = new Path(testDir, file);
384
385    FSDataOutputStream out = fs.create(p);
386    out.close();
387    assertTrue("The created file should be present", CommonFSUtils.isExists(fs, p));
388
389    long expect = EnvironmentEdgeManager.currentTime() + 1000;
390    assertNotEquals(expect, fs.getFileStatus(p).getModificationTime());
391
392    ManualEnvironmentEdge mockEnv = new ManualEnvironmentEdge();
393    mockEnv.setValue(expect);
394    EnvironmentEdgeManager.injectEdge(mockEnv);
395    try {
396      String dstFile = HBaseTestingUtil.getRandomUUID().toString();
397      Path dst = new Path(testDir, dstFile);
398
399      assertTrue(CommonFSUtils.renameAndSetModifyTime(fs, p, dst));
400      assertFalse("The moved file should not be present", CommonFSUtils.isExists(fs, p));
401      assertTrue("The dst file should be present", CommonFSUtils.isExists(fs, dst));
402
403      assertEquals(expect, fs.getFileStatus(dst).getModificationTime());
404      cluster.shutdown();
405    } finally {
406      EnvironmentEdgeManager.reset();
407    }
408  }
409
410  @Test
411  public void testSetStoragePolicyDefault() throws Exception {
412    verifyNoHDFSApiInvocationForDefaultPolicy();
413    verifyFileInDirWithStoragePolicy(HConstants.DEFAULT_WAL_STORAGE_POLICY);
414  }
415
416  /**
417   * Note: currently the default policy is set to defer to HDFS and this case is to verify the
418   * logic, will need to remove the check if the default policy is changed
419   */
420  private void verifyNoHDFSApiInvocationForDefaultPolicy() throws URISyntaxException, IOException {
421    FileSystem testFs = new AlwaysFailSetStoragePolicyFileSystem();
422    testFs.initialize(new URI("hdfs://localhost/"), conf);
423    // There should be no exception thrown when setting to default storage policy, which indicates
424    // the HDFS API hasn't been called
425    try {
426      CommonFSUtils.setStoragePolicy(testFs, new Path("non-exist"),
427        HConstants.DEFAULT_WAL_STORAGE_POLICY, true);
428    } catch (IOException e) {
429      Assert.fail("Should have bypassed the FS API when setting default storage policy");
430    }
431    // There should be exception thrown when given non-default storage policy, which indicates the
432    // HDFS API has been called
433    try {
434      CommonFSUtils.setStoragePolicy(testFs, new Path("non-exist"), "HOT", true);
435      Assert.fail("Should have invoked the FS API but haven't");
436    } catch (IOException e) {
437      // expected given an invalid path
438    }
439  }
440
441  class AlwaysFailSetStoragePolicyFileSystem extends DistributedFileSystem {
442    @Override
443    public void setStoragePolicy(final Path src, final String policyName) throws IOException {
444      throw new IOException("The setStoragePolicy method is invoked");
445    }
446  }
447
448  /* might log a warning, but still work. (always warning on Hadoop < 2.6.0) */
449  @Test
450  public void testSetStoragePolicyValidButMaybeNotPresent() throws Exception {
451    verifyFileInDirWithStoragePolicy("ALL_SSD");
452  }
453
454  final String INVALID_STORAGE_POLICY = "1772";
455
456  /* should log a warning, but still work. (different warning on Hadoop < 2.6.0) */
457  @Test
458  public void testSetStoragePolicyInvalid() throws Exception {
459    verifyFileInDirWithStoragePolicy(INVALID_STORAGE_POLICY);
460  }
461
462  // Here instead of TestCommonFSUtils because we need a minicluster
463  private void verifyFileInDirWithStoragePolicy(final String policy) throws Exception {
464    conf.set(HConstants.WAL_STORAGE_POLICY, policy);
465
466    MiniDFSCluster cluster = htu.startMiniDFSCluster(1);
467    try {
468      assertTrue(CommonFSUtils.isHDFS(conf));
469
470      FileSystem fs = FileSystem.get(conf);
471      Path testDir = htu.getDataTestDirOnTestFS("testArchiveFile");
472      fs.mkdirs(testDir);
473
474      String storagePolicy =
475        conf.get(HConstants.WAL_STORAGE_POLICY, HConstants.DEFAULT_WAL_STORAGE_POLICY);
476      CommonFSUtils.setStoragePolicy(fs, testDir, storagePolicy);
477
478      String file = HBaseTestingUtil.getRandomUUID().toString();
479      Path p = new Path(testDir, file);
480      WriteDataToHDFS(fs, p, 4096);
481      HFileSystem hfs = new HFileSystem(fs);
482      String policySet = hfs.getStoragePolicyName(p);
483      LOG.debug("The storage policy of path " + p + " is " + policySet);
484      if (
485        policy.equals(HConstants.DEFER_TO_HDFS_STORAGE_POLICY)
486          || policy.equals(INVALID_STORAGE_POLICY)
487      ) {
488        String hdfsDefaultPolicy = hfs.getStoragePolicyName(hfs.getHomeDirectory());
489        LOG.debug("The default hdfs storage policy (indicated by home path: "
490          + hfs.getHomeDirectory() + ") is " + hdfsDefaultPolicy);
491        Assert.assertEquals(hdfsDefaultPolicy, policySet);
492      } else {
493        Assert.assertEquals(policy, policySet);
494      }
495      // will assert existence before deleting.
496      cleanupFile(fs, testDir);
497    } finally {
498      cluster.shutdown();
499    }
500  }
501
502  /**
503   * Ugly test that ensures we can get at the hedged read counters in dfsclient. Does a bit of
504   * preading with hedged reads enabled using code taken from hdfs TestPread.
505   */
506  @Test
507  public void testDFSHedgedReadMetrics() throws Exception {
508    // Enable hedged reads and set it so the threshold is really low.
509    // Most of this test is taken from HDFS, from TestPread.
510    conf.setInt(DFSConfigKeys.DFS_DFSCLIENT_HEDGED_READ_THREADPOOL_SIZE, 5);
511    conf.setLong(DFSConfigKeys.DFS_DFSCLIENT_HEDGED_READ_THRESHOLD_MILLIS, 0);
512    conf.setLong(DFSConfigKeys.DFS_BLOCK_SIZE_KEY, 4096);
513    conf.setLong(DFSConfigKeys.DFS_CLIENT_READ_PREFETCH_SIZE_KEY, 4096);
514    // Set short retry timeouts so this test runs faster
515    conf.setInt(DFSConfigKeys.DFS_CLIENT_RETRY_WINDOW_BASE, 0);
516    conf.setBoolean("dfs.datanode.transferTo.allowed", false);
517    MiniDFSCluster cluster = new MiniDFSCluster.Builder(conf).numDataNodes(3).build();
518    // Get the metrics. Should be empty.
519    DFSHedgedReadMetrics metrics = FSUtils.getDFSHedgedReadMetrics(conf);
520    assertEquals(0, metrics.getHedgedReadOps());
521    FileSystem fileSys = cluster.getFileSystem();
522    try {
523      Path p = new Path("preadtest.dat");
524      // We need > 1 blocks to test out the hedged reads.
525      DFSTestUtil.createFile(fileSys, p, 12 * blockSize, 12 * blockSize, blockSize, (short) 3,
526        seed);
527      pReadFile(fileSys, p);
528      cleanupFile(fileSys, p);
529      assertTrue(metrics.getHedgedReadOps() > 0);
530    } finally {
531      fileSys.close();
532      cluster.shutdown();
533    }
534  }
535
536  @Test
537  public void testCopyFilesParallel() throws Exception {
538    MiniDFSCluster cluster = htu.startMiniDFSCluster(1);
539    cluster.waitActive();
540    FileSystem fs = cluster.getFileSystem();
541    Path src = new Path("/src");
542    fs.mkdirs(src);
543    for (int i = 0; i < 50; i++) {
544      WriteDataToHDFS(fs, new Path(src, String.valueOf(i)), 1024);
545    }
546    Path sub = new Path(src, "sub");
547    fs.mkdirs(sub);
548    for (int i = 0; i < 50; i++) {
549      WriteDataToHDFS(fs, new Path(sub, String.valueOf(i)), 1024);
550    }
551    Path dst = new Path("/dst");
552    List<Path> allFiles = FSUtils.copyFilesParallel(fs, src, fs, dst, conf, 4);
553
554    assertEquals(102, allFiles.size());
555    FileStatus[] list = fs.listStatus(dst);
556    assertEquals(51, list.length);
557    FileStatus[] sublist = fs.listStatus(new Path(dst, "sub"));
558    assertEquals(50, sublist.length);
559  }
560
561  // Below is taken from TestPread over in HDFS.
562  static final int blockSize = 4096;
563  static final long seed = 0xDEADBEEFL;
564  private Random rand = new Random(); // This test depends on Random#setSeed
565
566  private void pReadFile(FileSystem fileSys, Path name) throws IOException {
567    FSDataInputStream stm = fileSys.open(name);
568    byte[] expected = new byte[12 * blockSize];
569    rand.setSeed(seed);
570    rand.nextBytes(expected);
571    // do a sanity check. Read first 4K bytes
572    byte[] actual = new byte[4096];
573    stm.readFully(actual);
574    checkAndEraseData(actual, 0, expected, "Read Sanity Test");
575    // now do a pread for the first 8K bytes
576    actual = new byte[8192];
577    doPread(stm, 0L, actual, 0, 8192);
578    checkAndEraseData(actual, 0, expected, "Pread Test 1");
579    // Now check to see if the normal read returns 4K-8K byte range
580    actual = new byte[4096];
581    stm.readFully(actual);
582    checkAndEraseData(actual, 4096, expected, "Pread Test 2");
583    // Now see if we can cross a single block boundary successfully
584    // read 4K bytes from blockSize - 2K offset
585    stm.readFully(blockSize - 2048, actual, 0, 4096);
586    checkAndEraseData(actual, (blockSize - 2048), expected, "Pread Test 3");
587    // now see if we can cross two block boundaries successfully
588    // read blockSize + 4K bytes from blockSize - 2K offset
589    actual = new byte[blockSize + 4096];
590    stm.readFully(blockSize - 2048, actual);
591    checkAndEraseData(actual, (blockSize - 2048), expected, "Pread Test 4");
592    // now see if we can cross two block boundaries that are not cached
593    // read blockSize + 4K bytes from 10*blockSize - 2K offset
594    actual = new byte[blockSize + 4096];
595    stm.readFully(10 * blockSize - 2048, actual);
596    checkAndEraseData(actual, (10 * blockSize - 2048), expected, "Pread Test 5");
597    // now check that even after all these preads, we can still read
598    // bytes 8K-12K
599    actual = new byte[4096];
600    stm.readFully(actual);
601    checkAndEraseData(actual, 8192, expected, "Pread Test 6");
602    // done
603    stm.close();
604    // check block location caching
605    stm = fileSys.open(name);
606    stm.readFully(1, actual, 0, 4096);
607    stm.readFully(4 * blockSize, actual, 0, 4096);
608    stm.readFully(7 * blockSize, actual, 0, 4096);
609    actual = new byte[3 * 4096];
610    stm.readFully(0 * blockSize, actual, 0, 3 * 4096);
611    checkAndEraseData(actual, 0, expected, "Pread Test 7");
612    actual = new byte[8 * 4096];
613    stm.readFully(3 * blockSize, actual, 0, 8 * 4096);
614    checkAndEraseData(actual, 3 * blockSize, expected, "Pread Test 8");
615    // read the tail
616    stm.readFully(11 * blockSize + blockSize / 2, actual, 0, blockSize / 2);
617    IOException res = null;
618    try { // read beyond the end of the file
619      stm.readFully(11 * blockSize + blockSize / 2, actual, 0, blockSize);
620    } catch (IOException e) {
621      // should throw an exception
622      res = e;
623    }
624    assertTrue("Error reading beyond file boundary.", res != null);
625
626    stm.close();
627  }
628
629  private void checkAndEraseData(byte[] actual, int from, byte[] expected, String message) {
630    for (int idx = 0; idx < actual.length; idx++) {
631      assertEquals(message + " byte " + (from + idx) + " differs. expected " + expected[from + idx]
632        + " actual " + actual[idx], actual[idx], expected[from + idx]);
633      actual[idx] = 0;
634    }
635  }
636
637  private void doPread(FSDataInputStream stm, long position, byte[] buffer, int offset, int length)
638    throws IOException {
639    int nread = 0;
640    // long totalRead = 0;
641    // DFSInputStream dfstm = null;
642
643    /*
644     * Disable. This counts do not add up. Some issue in original hdfs tests? if
645     * (stm.getWrappedStream() instanceof DFSInputStream) { dfstm = (DFSInputStream)
646     * (stm.getWrappedStream()); totalRead = dfstm.getReadStatistics().getTotalBytesRead(); }
647     */
648
649    while (nread < length) {
650      int nbytes = stm.read(position + nread, buffer, offset + nread, length - nread);
651      assertTrue("Error in pread", nbytes > 0);
652      nread += nbytes;
653    }
654
655    /*
656     * Disable. This counts do not add up. Some issue in original hdfs tests? if (dfstm != null) {
657     * if (isHedgedRead) { assertTrue("Expected read statistic to be incremented", length <=
658     * dfstm.getReadStatistics().getTotalBytesRead() - totalRead); } else {
659     * assertEquals("Expected read statistic to be incremented", length, dfstm
660     * .getReadStatistics().getTotalBytesRead() - totalRead); } }
661     */
662  }
663
664  private void cleanupFile(FileSystem fileSys, Path name) throws IOException {
665    assertTrue(fileSys.exists(name));
666    assertTrue(fileSys.delete(name, true));
667    assertTrue(!fileSys.exists(name));
668  }
669
670  static {
671    try {
672      Class.forName("org.apache.hadoop.fs.StreamCapabilities");
673      LOG.debug("Test thought StreamCapabilities class was present.");
674    } catch (ClassNotFoundException exception) {
675      LOG.debug("Test didn't think StreamCapabilities class was present.");
676    }
677  }
678
679  // Here instead of TestCommonFSUtils because we need a minicluster
680  @Test
681  public void checkStreamCapabilitiesOnHdfsDataOutputStream() throws Exception {
682    MiniDFSCluster cluster = htu.startMiniDFSCluster(1);
683    try (FileSystem filesystem = cluster.getFileSystem()) {
684      FSDataOutputStream stream = filesystem.create(new Path("/tmp/foobar"));
685      assertTrue(stream.hasCapability(StreamCapabilities.HSYNC));
686      assertTrue(stream.hasCapability(StreamCapabilities.HFLUSH));
687      assertFalse(stream.hasCapability("a capability that hopefully HDFS doesn't add."));
688    } finally {
689      cluster.shutdown();
690    }
691  }
692
693  private void testIsSameHdfs(int nnport) throws IOException {
694    Configuration conf = HBaseConfiguration.create();
695    Path srcPath = new Path("hdfs://localhost:" + nnport + "/");
696    Path desPath = new Path("hdfs://127.0.0.1/");
697    FileSystem srcFs = srcPath.getFileSystem(conf);
698    FileSystem desFs = desPath.getFileSystem(conf);
699
700    assertTrue(FSUtils.isSameHdfs(conf, srcFs, desFs));
701
702    desPath = new Path("hdfs://127.0.0.1:8070/");
703    desFs = desPath.getFileSystem(conf);
704    assertTrue(!FSUtils.isSameHdfs(conf, srcFs, desFs));
705
706    desPath = new Path("hdfs://127.0.1.1:" + nnport + "/");
707    desFs = desPath.getFileSystem(conf);
708    assertTrue(!FSUtils.isSameHdfs(conf, srcFs, desFs));
709
710    conf.set("fs.defaultFS", "hdfs://haosong-hadoop");
711    conf.set("dfs.nameservices", "haosong-hadoop");
712    conf.set("dfs.ha.namenodes.haosong-hadoop", "nn1,nn2");
713    conf.set("dfs.client.failover.proxy.provider.haosong-hadoop",
714      "org.apache.hadoop.hdfs.server.namenode.ha.ConfiguredFailoverProxyProvider");
715
716    conf.set("dfs.namenode.rpc-address.haosong-hadoop.nn1", "127.0.0.1:" + nnport);
717    conf.set("dfs.namenode.rpc-address.haosong-hadoop.nn2", "127.10.2.1:8000");
718    desPath = new Path("/");
719    desFs = desPath.getFileSystem(conf);
720    assertTrue(FSUtils.isSameHdfs(conf, srcFs, desFs));
721
722    conf.set("dfs.namenode.rpc-address.haosong-hadoop.nn1", "127.10.2.1:" + nnport);
723    conf.set("dfs.namenode.rpc-address.haosong-hadoop.nn2", "127.0.0.1:8000");
724    desPath = new Path("/");
725    desFs = desPath.getFileSystem(conf);
726    assertTrue(!FSUtils.isSameHdfs(conf, srcFs, desFs));
727  }
728
729  @Test
730  public void testIsSameHdfs() throws IOException {
731    String hadoopVersion = org.apache.hadoop.util.VersionInfo.getVersion();
732    LOG.info("hadoop version is: " + hadoopVersion);
733    boolean isHadoop3_0_0 = hadoopVersion.startsWith("3.0.0");
734    if (isHadoop3_0_0) {
735      // Hadoop 3.0.0 alpha1+ ~ 3.0.0 GA changed default nn port to 9820.
736      // See HDFS-9427
737      testIsSameHdfs(9820);
738    } else {
739      // pre hadoop 3.0.0 defaults to port 8020
740      // Hadoop 3.0.1 changed it back to port 8020. See HDFS-12990
741      testIsSameHdfs(8020);
742    }
743  }
744}
